questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own _____; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
questions.hint: This word relates to human intellect and reasoning
questions.explanation: We are called to trust God completely rather than relying on our own limited human understanding.
questions.full_verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The fear of the LORD is the beginning of _____; fools despise wisdom and instruction.'
questions.hint: This is what fools despise along with instruction
questions.explanation: Reverence for God is the foundation of all true knowledge.
questions.full_verse: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Start _____ in the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it.'
questions.hint: This refers to young ones being raised
questions.explanation: Early spiritual training has lasting effects throughout a person's life.
questions.full_verse: Start children in the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and he will establish your _____.'
questions.hint: This word refers to your intentions for the future
questions.explanation: When we dedicate our work to God, He guides and establishes our intentions.
questions.full_verse: Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and he will establish your plans.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Let love and _____ never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.'
questions.hint: This virtue relates to being loyal and reliable
questions.explanation: Love and faithfulness should be constant companions, shaping our character.
questions.full_verse: Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Above all else, guard your _____, for everything you do flows from it.'
questions.hint: This is the center of your being and emotions
questions.explanation: The heart is the wellspring of life, affecting all our thoughts, words, and actions.
questions.full_verse: Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The name of the LORD is a fortified _____; the righteous run to it and are safe.'
questions.hint: This is a tall structure used for defense
questions.explanation: God's name represents His character and power, providing protection for those who trust Him.
questions.full_verse: The name of the LORD is a fortified tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens _____.'
questions.hint: This refers to a single other individual
questions.explanation: Healthy relationships help us grow and improve through mutual encouragement and challenge.
questions.full_verse: As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the LORD is to be _____.'
questions.hint: This means to be commended or celebrated
questions.explanation: True worth is found in reverence for God, not outward appearance.
questions.full_verse: Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A generous person will _____; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.'
questions.hint: This means to do well or succeed
questions.explanation: Generosity brings blessings back to the giver.
questions.full_verse: A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the _____ of all your crops.'
questions.hint: This refers to the first portion of your harvest
questions.explanation: Giving God the first and best of our income shows trust and gratitude.
questions.full_verse: Honor the LORD with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers over all _____.'
questions.hint: This refers to mistakes or offenses
questions.explanation: Love chooses to forgive rather than hold grudges.
questions.full_verse: Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers over all wrongs.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'When pride comes, then comes _____; but with humility comes wisdom.'
questions.hint: This is the opposite of honor
questions.explanation: Pride leads to shame, while humility leads to wisdom.
questions.full_verse: When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Anxiety weighs down the heart, but a kind word cheers it _____.'
questions.hint: This small word indicates the direction of lifting
questions.explanation: Encouraging words have the power to lift spirits weighed down by worry.
questions.full_verse: Anxiety weighs down the heart, but a kind word cheers it up.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of _____.'
questions.hint: This is what the tree provides
questions.explanation: Delayed hopes can be discouraging, but fulfilled desires bring vitality and joy.
questions.full_verse: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'There is a way that appears to be right, but in the end it leads to _____.'
questions.hint: This is the ultimate consequence
questions.explanation: Human judgment can be deceived; what seems right may lead to destruction.
questions.full_verse: There is a way that appears to be right, but in the end it leads to death.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up _____.'
questions.hint: This emotion is provoked by harsh words
questions.explanation: How we respond can either defuse or escalate conflict.
questions.full_verse: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'In their hearts humans plan their course, but the LORD establishes their _____.'
questions.hint: This refers to individual movements forward
questions.explanation: We can make plans, but God ultimately directs our path.
questions.full_verse: In their hearts humans plan their course, but the LORD establishes their steps.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of _____.'
questions.hint: This word means difficult circumstances
questions.explanation: True friends and family are there during difficult times.
questions.full_verse: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'One who has unreliable friends soon comes to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a _____.'
questions.hint: This is a male family member
questions.explanation: True friendship can be even closer than family bonds.
questions.full_verse: One who has unreliable friends soon comes to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Many are the plans in a person's heart, but it is the LORD's _____ that prevails.'
questions.hint: This refers to God's intention or design
questions.explanation: Human plans are many, but God's sovereign purpose will ultimately be accomplished.
questions.full_verse: Many are the plans in a person's heart, but it is the LORD's purpose that prevails.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The righteous lead blameless lives; blessed are their _____ after them.'
questions.hint: These are the sons and daughters
questions.explanation: A righteous life leaves a positive legacy for future generations.
questions.full_verse: The righteous lead blameless lives; blessed are their children after them.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Whoever pursues righteousness and love finds life, _____, and honor.'
questions.hint: This word means success and flourishing
questions.explanation: Pursuing righteousness and love leads to a full and blessed life.
questions.full_verse: Whoever pursues righteousness and love finds life, prosperity, and honor.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A good name is more desirable than great _____; to be esteemed is better than silver or gold.'
questions.hint: This word refers to abundant wealth
questions.explanation: Character and reputation are more valuable than material wealth.
questions.full_verse: A good name is more desirable than great riches; to be esteemed is better than silver or gold.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of _____.'
questions.hint: This is what instruction aims to impart
questions.explanation: We should eagerly receive both instruction and knowledge.
questions.full_verse: Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For though the righteous fall seven times, they rise _____; but the wicked stumble when calamity strikes.'
questions.hint: This word indicates repetition after falling
questions.explanation: The righteous demonstrate resilience, getting back up after failures.
questions.full_verse: For though the righteous fall seven times, they rise again, but the wicked stumble when calamity strikes.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of _____.'
questions.hint: This precious metal provides the setting
questions.explanation: Well-timed, appropriate words are beautiful and valuable.
questions.full_verse: A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Without wood a fire goes out; without a _____ a quarrel dies down.'
questions.hint: This refers to someone who spreads rumors
questions.explanation: Conflict is sustained by those who spread negative talk about others.
questions.full_verse: Without wood a fire goes out; without a gossip a quarrel dies down.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Do not boast about _____; for you do not know what a day may bring.'
questions.hint: This refers to the next day
questions.explanation: We should not presume upon the future, as it is uncertain.
questions.full_verse: Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Whoever conceals their sins does not prosper, but the one who confesses and renounces them finds _____.'
questions.hint: This is compassionate treatment
questions.explanation: Confession and repentance lead to God's mercy.
questions.full_verse: Whoever conceals their sins does not prosper, but the one who confesses and renounces them finds mercy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Fear of man will prove to be a _____; but whoever trusts in the LORD is kept safe.'
questions.hint: This is something that catches and traps
questions.explanation: Being controlled by what others think can trap us, but trusting God brings security.
questions.full_verse: Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the LORD is kept safe.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Every word of God is _____; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.'
questions.hint: This means without any defects
questions.explanation: God's Word is completely reliable and trustworthy.
questions.full_verse: Every word of God is flawless; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the LORD gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and _____.'
questions.hint: This is the ability to comprehend
questions.explanation: True wisdom, knowledge, and understanding all come from God.
questions.full_verse: For the LORD gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'My son, do not despise the LORD's discipline, and do not resent his _____.'
questions.hint: This is a sharp expression of disapproval
questions.explanation: God disciplines those He loves, and we should accept His correction.
questions.full_verse: My son, do not despise the LORD's discipline, and do not resent his rebuke, because the LORD disciplines those he loves, as a father the son he delights in.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The beginning of wisdom is this: Get _____. Though it cost all you have, get understanding.'
questions.hint: This is what the verse says to obtain
questions.explanation: Wisdom is so valuable that it's worth pursuing at any cost.
questions.full_verse: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom. Though it cost all you have, get understanding.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into _____, a false witness who pours out lies, and a person who stirs up conflict in the community.'
questions.hint: This is the opposite of good
questions.explanation: God hates various forms of wickedness, including those eager to do wrong.
questions.full_verse: There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into evil, a false witness who pours out lies and a person who stirs up conflict in the community.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is _____.'
questions.hint: This is the ability to comprehend deeply
questions.explanation: True wisdom begins with reverence for God, and knowing Him brings understanding.
questions.full_verse: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The blessing of the LORD brings wealth, without painful _____ for it.'
questions.hint: This is hard, exhausting work
questions.explanation: God's blessing brings prosperity without the burden of anxious striving.
questions.full_verse: The blessing of the LORD brings wealth, without painful toil for it.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For lack of guidance a nation falls, but victory is won through many _____.'
questions.hint: These are people who give advice
questions.explanation: Wise counsel from many sources leads to success.
questions.full_verse: For lack of guidance a nation falls, but victory is won through many advisers.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The way of fools seems right to them, but the wise listen to _____.'
questions.hint: This is guidance or recommendations from others
questions.explanation: Fools trust their own judgment; the wise seek and heed counsel.
questions.full_verse: The way of fools seems right to them, but the wise listen to advice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Whoever is patient has great understanding, but one who is quick-tempered displays _____.'
questions.hint: This is the opposite of wisdom
questions.explanation: Patience reflects wisdom, while a quick temper shows foolishness.
questions.full_verse: Whoever is patient has great understanding, but one who is quick-tempered displays folly.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Plans fail for lack of _____; but with many advisers they succeed.'
questions.hint: This is advice or guidance
questions.explanation: Seeking wise counsel helps ensure success in our plans.
questions.full_verse: Plans fail for lack of counsel, but with many advisers they succeed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a _____.'
questions.hint: This is a sudden drop or collapse
questions.explanation: Pride leads to destruction and downfall.
questions.full_verse: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A cheerful heart is good _____; but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.'
questions.hint: This is something that heals
questions.explanation: Joy and cheerfulness have a healing effect on our whole being.
questions.full_verse: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Whoever is kind to the poor lends to the _____; and he will reward them for what they have done.'
questions.hint: This is the covenant name of God
questions.explanation: Helping the poor is like lending to God, who promises to repay.
questions.full_verse: Whoever is kind to the poor lends to the LORD, and he will reward them for what they have done.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Do not say, "I'll pay you back for this wrong!" Wait for the LORD, and he will _____ you.'
questions.hint: This means to take revenge on someone's behalf
questions.explanation: Rather than seeking revenge, we should trust God to bring justice.
questions.full_verse: Do not say, "I'll pay you back for this wrong!" Wait for the LORD, and he will avenge you.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'To do what is right and just is more acceptable to the LORD than _____.'
questions.hint: This is a religious offering
questions.explanation: God values righteous living over religious rituals.
questions.full_verse: To do what is right and just is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Humility is the fear of the LORD; its wages are riches and _____ and life.'
questions.hint: This is high respect or esteem
questions.explanation: Humility and reverence for God lead to rich rewards including honor and life.
questions.full_verse: Humility is the fear of the LORD; its wages are riches and honor and life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than _____.'
questions.hint: These are precious red gemstones
questions.explanation: A virtuous wife is more valuable than precious gems.
questions.full_verse: A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and shun _____.'
questions.hint: This is what we should avoid
questions.explanation: True wisdom involves fearing God and turning away from evil.
questions.full_verse: Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and shun evil.
